author: Annie Brock

review: If you don't have a Chromecast but have a newer flat panel TV with HDMI ports then you should get one.  Chromecast is great.  We've finally cut the cable and are going fully Chromecast and SmartTV.  Tired of the expensive every increasing cable bills.  Chromecast will give you lots of nice free features but you still have to pay for services like Netflix or Hulu.I like to get on YouTube and find a 3 hour fireplace or aquarium video and just play it for background noise.  Works with iPhone, Droid and iPad.  Easy to use.  Requires internet connection, preferably high speed.

author: Amazon Customer

review: I was skeptical about the whole HDMI/USB Media Player stick before I made this purchase.  I was content with the ROKU stand alone boxes.What made me make the change?  I wanted to be able to stream HBO GO and my cable provider does not allow you to stream it on ROKU.  I figured this was a good option because of the price…What I love about it -- There are a huge amount of apps HBO Go, Starz Play, SHO, Encore, etc…You don't see it because it's plugged into the back of my TVYou don't have to plug it into the wall for power (unless you want to).  It has a USB plug which plugs right into your TV for powerThe quality of the video is greatWhat I don't love -- No remote is included, so you have to use your smart phone to operate itChromecast is still in beta so it lags a bit, meaning you can stream content from your Chrome browser onto your screen (although, this feature is impressive, it still has lag issues)Overall, for the money you can't beat this player.  Don't overlook it!
